author: oripomerantz
content:
<@!543900561460822016> , `geth` seems to have a bug where if there are multiple transactions that add up to more than `gasTarget` it fails.

This works:
```
  - blockHeader:
      gasTarget: 0x157c0
    transactions:
    - data: ''
      accessList: []
      gasLimit: 0x10000
      tip: 0x00
      feeCap: 2000
      nonce: auto
      secretKey: 41f6e321b31e72173f8ff2e292359e1862f24fba42fe6f97efaf641980eff298
      to: 0x1111111111111111111111111111111111111111
      value: 0x0
    - data: ''
      accessList: []
      gasLimit: 0x57c0
      tip: 0x00
      feeCap: 2000
      nonce: auto
      secretKey: 41f6e321b31e72173f8ff2e292359e1862f24fba42fe6f97efaf641980eff298
      to: 0x1111111111111111111111111111111111111111
      value: 0x0
```

(0x111...111 has the code 0xFE so it spends all the gas it is given)

However, if I add one to the gas limit the second transaction doesn't get mined.
```
  - blockHeader:
      gasTarget: 0x157c0
    transactions:
    - data: ''
      accessList: []
      gasLimit: 0x10000
      tip: 0x00
      feeCap: 2000
      nonce: auto
      secretKey: 41f6e321b31e72173f8ff2e292359e1862f24fba42fe6f97efaf641980eff298
      to: 0x1111111111111111111111111111111111111111
      value: 0x0
    - data: ''
      accessList: []
      gasLimit: 0x57c1
      tip: 0x00
      feeCap: 2000
      nonce: auto
      secretKey: 41f6e321b31e72173f8ff2e292359e1862f24fba42fe6f97efaf641980eff298
      to: 0x1111111111111111111111111111111111111111
      value: 0x0
```

I use this version of geth `git clone --depth 1 -b eip1559 https://github.com/quilt/go-ethereum.git /geth`
